SEARCH
Package librarySE.repo

Class FileUserRepository

java.lang.Object
librarySE.repo.FileUserRepository
All Implemented Interfaces:
UserRepository
public class FileUserRepository extends Object implements UserRepository
File-based implementation of UserRepository that persists user data in JSON format.

This repository saves and loads users from a JSON file named users.json inside the library_data directory. The directory is created automatically if it does not exist.

Storage Details

  • JSON serialization/deserialization using Gson
  • File location: library_data/users.json
  • A backup copy of the old file is automatically created before saving new data

Responsibilities

  • Load all stored users during system initialization
  • Persist new or modified users when saving

Behavior

  • If the file does not exist, loadAll() returns an empty list
  • saveAll(List) creates the file automatically if missing
  • All write operations overwrite existing data and create a timestamped backup first

Usage Example


 UserRepository repo = new FileUserRepository();

 // Load all users
 List<User> users = repo.loadAll();

 // Add a user
 users.add(new User("eman", Role.ADMIN, "123456", "eman@najah.edu"));

 // Save back to file
 repo.saveAll(users);
Author:
Malak

  • Constructor Details

      public FileUserRepository()

  • Method Details

    • loadAll

      public List<User> loadAll()
      Loads all previously stored users from the JSON file.

      If the file is missing, this method returns an empty list instead of null. Errors during reading trigger a runtime exception.

      Specified by:
      loadAll in interface UserRepository
      Returns:
      a list of stored users; never null, may be empty

    • saveAll

      public void saveAll(List<User> users)
      Saves the given list of users into the JSON file.

      The existing data is replaced, and a timestamped backup copy of the previous file (if it existed) is stored under library_data/backups.

      Specified by:
      saveAll in interface UserRepository
      Parameters:
      users - the list of users to persist (must not be null)
